page.title: 01General Description
page.content: Within this predominantly farming area there are a few isolated farmhouses and the village of Tetsworth. St.Gile's church, built on a hill, is a familiar sight to travellers on the M40 between Oxford and the Chiltern Hills. Those who take 'the old London Road' the A40-will discover Tetsworth is a small village built mainly along and to the south of the road. On the north side there are a few houses, a village green,Inn, school and chapel. Just outside the village is Attington Stud,a small estate specialising in breeding race horses. In the N.E.corner of the area is Thame Park, a private estate. From the road one can see the ruins of the monastery destroyed in the time of Henry VIII. To the south of the area lies the Copcourt Estate including a moated manor house.
